Posted By: .Blaze. (1/24/2013 1:13:36 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: It's amazing to me how many deck types would love a card like this, it's a 3 mana silence for combo (not that combo's good in standard currently) it slows down aggro for control decks, it lets you kill any blockers in aggro or just tap them and point those last few points of damage at the player's dome, (think about it, if they flash in a Resto angel after declare attackers you can tap it down before they can declare blockers), it can kill most planeswalkers if their controller decides to use their - ability right away, maybe I'm wrong but this much versatility seems like it's got a pretty good chance of shaping standard for quite a while
posts.html:

Posted By: swords_to_exile (1/24/2013 6:28:38 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card isn't made for burning like comet storm or bonefire of the damned and clean the board.  
  
It's to remove as many blocker of the way, prevent any trick from the defending player and toss all the remaining mana on the player for the final attack.  
  
If you want to hit hard, the X will need to be big, and it's not the point of the card.  
  
It's all about tapping and the silence, the red part is only a bit more versatily against plainwalker or a must kill creature.  
  
It fit a weenie deck for when the weenie need a little help to bash the opponent.
posts.html:
This card isn't made for burning like comet storm or bonefire of the damned and clean the board.

It's to remove as many blocker of the way, prevent any trick from the defending player and toss all the remaining mana on the player for the final attack.

If you want to hit hard, the X will need to be big, and it's not the point of the card.

It's all about tapping and the silence, the red part is only a bit more versatily against plainwalker or a must kill creature.

It fit a weenie deck for when the weenie need a little help to bash the opponent.

Posted By: Dream_Twist (1/23/2013 8:21:32 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Just what aggro needs - kills chumps, taps blockers for an alpha strike and delays wraths by a turn. It's powerful enough that you could play it at 3 mana (likely hitting the player during upkeep), and it only gets better from there.  
  
Control could also use this as a delaying tool and for killing weenies, though [Bonfire of the Damned](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bonfire of the Damned) and [Supreme Verdict](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Supreme Verdict) just seem better in that regard.
posts.html:
Just what aggro needs - kills chumps, taps blockers for an alpha strike and delays wraths by a turn. It's powerful enough that you could play it at 3 mana (likely hitting the player during upkeep), and it only gets better from there.

Control could also use this as a delaying tool and for killing weenies, though Bonfire of the Damned and Supreme Verdict just seem better in that regard.
